"Then, he should recite two Yaθā ahū variiō and yasnəmca until āfrīnāmi ahurahe mazdā̊ raēuuatō xᵛarənaŋhatō. Then they remove the hand from the vars, say the vāǧ and put it into the varsdān. Then he should take the parāhum and remove again the vars (from the varsdān), dry it and put it between the (two pieces) of the māhruy. He should put it at its own place, in one dry place, in a niche. For the vars and the place for the vars (there must be) at least two herbads who know that the view (of the vars) is forbidden. Once the vars is boiled, everytime they want to use the vars, they must celebrate a Zende-ravān with the šnūman of the day so that it might be accepted."
